shortdesc.ph: Sets the properties of an extension.

p.codeblock: abstract setExtensionProperty( provider: string, extension: string, key: string, value: string, type?: MediaSourceType ): number;
abstract setExtensionProperty( provider: string, extension: string, key: string, value: string, type?: MediaSourceType ): number;
Future<void> setExtensionProperty( {required String provider, required String extension, required String key, required String value, MediaSourceType type = MediaSourceType.unknownMediaSource});
public abstract int SetExtensionProperty(string provider, string extension, string key, string value, MEDIA_SOURCE_TYPE type = MEDIA_SOURCE_TYPE.UNKNOWN_MEDIA_SOURCE);

section.p: After enabling an extension, you can call this method to set its properties.
After enabling a plugin, you can call this method to set its properties.
After enabling the extension, you can call this method to set its properties.
After enabling an extension, you can call this method to set its properties.
section.note: To set properties for multiple extensions, you need to call this method multiple times.
To set properties for multiple plugins, call this method multiple times.
To set properties for multiple extensions, call this method multiple times.
To set properties for multiple extensions, call this method multiple times.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Call this method after calling to enable the extension.
Call this method after calling to enable the plugin.
Call this method after calling to enable the extension.
Call this method after calling to enable the extension.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After calling this method, the extension event callback may be triggered. The specific trigger logic depends on the extension itself.
After calling this method, the plugin event callback may be triggered. The specific trigger logic depends on the plugin itself.
After calling this method, the extension may trigger the callback. The specific trigger logic depends on the extension itself.
After calling this method, the extension event callback may be triggered depending on the extension's logic.

plentry.pd: The name of the extension provider.
The name of the extension.
The key of the extension property.
The value corresponding to the extension property key.
The media source type of the extension. See .
The name of the plugin provider.
The name of the plugin.
The key of the plugin property.
The value corresponding to the plugin property key.
The media source type of the plugin. See .
The name of the extension provider.
The name of the extension.
The key of the extension property.
The value corresponding to the extension property key.
The media source type of the extension. See .
The name of the extension provider.
The name of the extension.
The key of the extension property.
The value corresponding to the extension property key.
The media source type of the extension. See .

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
